description: Le Financier is a dainty French almond cookie that resembles a tiny cake, slightly chewy on the outside and moist on the inside.
ingredients: [{"name": "powdered sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "almond flour", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "salt", "units": null, "amount": "pinch"}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.33}, {"name": "pure almond extract", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "egg whites", "units": null, "amount": 3}, {"name": "sliced almonds", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": 2}]
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350F (175C). 2. Melt the butter in a skillet until it turns amber. 3. Transfer the butter to a bowl, add almond extract, and let cool. 4. Sift together powdered sugar, almond flour, all-purpose flour, and salt. 5. Combine the cooled butter with dry ingredients to form a paste. 6. Add egg whites in two batches, whisking until smooth. 7. Pipe the batter into a financier mold, top with sliced almonds. 8. Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown. 9. Allow to cool before removing from the mold.
notes: Using convection setting at 325F (170C) yields better results. Ensure butter does not burn when browning.
